name: Derek Knight
body:
## DEV-OPS ENGINEER  
__derek.a.knight@icloud.com | [linkedin.com/in/derekaknight](https://www.linkedin.com/in/derekaknight)__

___

*Solutions-driven Engineer with a record of commended performance in an ever changing environment. Knowledgeable about the software development lifecycle, with a working knowledge of algorithms and data structures. Proven success in engineering customized solutions improving business processes, operations and profitability. Able to ensure functions with a role are preformed successfully and with the least impact to the environment in which they reside.*

___
## WORK HISTORY
### 2013-2016 
_Systems Analyst | Network Engineer Baldor Electric_
 
***DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:***
* Designed, deployed, and maintained various systems associated with the Infrastructure Operations
* Prepared, evaluated, and maintained tools and process automation
* Created, managed, and executed scripts (Python) to develop within environment
* Developed dashboards to quantify internal processes efficiency continuously
    - Managed RESTful API (Cisco PI 3.x) >> Integrated with 'PERSONAL PROJECT'
* Reviewed and recommended changes to projects, management, and recovery processes
* Capable of leading projects end-to-end, independently with very minimal management supervision
* Creation of all critical documentation to include design, quoting, and configuration

***SKILLS USED:***
* Web - HTML | CSS | JAVASCRIPT | BOOTSTRAP
* Development - JAVA | C | C++ | ObjC | C# | Python | Swift
* System  - Git | Linux | Win | Mac
* Network - SNMP | API Design | OSI Model | EIGRP | OSPF

###2007-2009 
_IT Manager | U.S. Marine Corps Sergeant (E-5)_

***DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:***
* In an international environment working with locals NATO and ISAF 
* Maintained and managed close interpersonal and professional work relations
* Assisted the planning and installation of all Server, Exchange, and AD.
* Coordinated everyday operational maintains with 30 plus different countries.
* Supervisor of 10 to 30 personnel.
* Established training to pass on knowledge of infrequently used equipment.
* Responsible for the research, testing, and eval. of new technology.
* Maintained detailed accountability of hardware and assets.
* Provide direct software, hardware, and network support for 1000+ LAN users.

***SKILLS USED:***
* Management - Personal review | Coaching | Training
* Communication - Team Building Functions | Open Door Policy

###2005-2007
_Systems Administrator | U.S. Marine Corps Corporal (E-4)_

***DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:***
* Deployed and Support LANs, WANs, internet, and intranet systems.
* Monitor networks to ensure security and availability to specific users.
* Evaluate and modify system''s performance using Solarwinds Orion.
* Maintain integrity of the network, server deployment, and security.
* Configured EIGRP and Routing Configurations tables.
* Assign configuration of OAuth of directory services.


###2004-2005 
_Helpdesk Support | U.S. Marine Corps Lance Corporal (E-3)_

***DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:***
* Provide technical assistance and support for incoming queries and issues.
* Respond to queries either in person or over the phone.
* Write training manuals.
* Walk customer through problem-solving process.
* Install, modify, and repair computer hardware and software.
* Run diagnostic programs to resolve problems.

___
## EDUCATION

### 2010-2013 
_BS in Computer Programming | University of Arkansas_

* All course work was applied and not theoretical
* Project Leader for five individual projects including:
    - help-desk system
    - Java web service blog
    - COBOL student registration system
* Java, C#, and C++ application development and testing
* Developed and configured SQL and MYSQL databases
* Project management using AGILE
* SDLC Projects using Spiral Method

___
##PERSONAL PROJECTS

###2015 - N/A
_Syntax Commenting_

- Adding Commenting to projects I find helpful on GitHub.
- This is done within all my known languages to further my understanding of them.

###2015 - 2nd Qtr. 2016
_Terminal Session Manager_

- Develop scripts with Python to allow for better management of devices
- Developing a telnet session management client using:
  + Python, Java, ObjC, Swift, and XML/JSON
  + For mobile devices to allow access remotely.

###2015 - 1st Qtr. 2016
_Learning A Full Stack_

- Bootstrap, Angular.js, MongoDB, HTML5, CSS3

###2016 - TBD
_Remote Management Tool_
 
- API integration with HTML/CSS/Javascript/AngularJS
- 'Effort to make' iPad App for remote management
    * Web Interface (ASP.Net + Bootstrap)
    * iPad (ObjC + Swift + API + Python)
    * Automated tasked (Chef or Puppet or Prime)

___
